intro: Cistanche lutea, commonly known as the yellow苁蓉, is a parasitic plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It lacks chlorophyll and relies on host plants for nutrients, typically growing on the roots of various species in the Araliaceae family. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Asia, including China, Mongolia, and Russia. Its medicinal properties have been valued in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported ability to enhance vitality and sexual function. The tubular, yellowish stems and lack of leaves are distinctive botanical features of this species.
